main event: Five amber-colored lights were observed in a V formation over Elko, Nevada, on 29 May 1949.
interesting points: The lights were estimated to be about 1,000 feet in the air and traveling west at a speed of over 500 miles per hour,The observer was a yard clerk for the Western Pacific Railroad Company,The incident was reported around 0200 local time,The lights appeared to be steady and emitted no sound,The report could not establish whether the lights were from one large aircraft or five smaller ones in formation.
sighted object: five amber-colored lights in a V formation
witness description: yard clerk at the Western Pacific Railroad Company
